intro: Ilex diplosperma, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, glossy leaves. It produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex diplosperma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
